conclusion: Determine the initial and final states of the gas.
State A: P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3
State B: P_B = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 4 x 10^-3 m^3
State C: P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 4 x 10^-3 m^3
Calculate the work done during each segment of the process.
Segment AB is a horizontal line indicating constant pressure.
Work done W_AB = P_A (V_B - V_A) = 900 J
Segment BC is a vertical line indicating constant volume.
Calculate the total work done W_total = W_AB + W_BC = 900 J
Use the first law of thermodynamics to find the heat Q.
Q = ΔU + W, where ΔU = 200 J and W_total = 900 J
Substitute values into the equation: Q = 200 J + 900 J = 1100 J
The heat Q exchanged is 1100 J.
